skill.name: dbt-transformation-patterns
skill.description: Master dbt (data build tool) for analytics engineering with model organization, testing, documentation, and incremental strategies. Use when building data transformations, creating data models, or implementing analytics engineering best practices.
skill.summary: Master dbt (data build tool) for analytics engineering with model organization, testing, documentati...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: No data theft or malicious execution patterns detected. The skill content is static documentation with SQL and YAML examples only.

content.user_title: Build dbt transformations with proven patterns
content.value_statement: Building reliable dbt transformations can be slow without structure. This skill provides layered patterns, tests, and incremental strategies you can apply quickly.
actual_capabilities: Explain staging, intermediate, and marts layers with naming conventions
Show incremental model configurations and filters
Draft source and model YAML definitions with tests
Share macro patterns for reusable SQL
limitations: Does not run dbt commands or validate outputs
Examples must be adapted to your warehouse and schema
Does not generate full project files automatically

use_cases.title: Standardize model layers
use_cases.description: Adopt staging, intermediate, and marts patterns with consistent naming and structure.

use_cases.title: Improve data quality
use_cases.description: Add tests and documentation patterns for key models and sources.

use_cases.title: Start a dbt project
use_cases.description: Set up dbt_project.yml and a clear folder layout for models.

prompt_templates.title: Layering basics
prompt_templates.scenario: You are new to dbt model structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain a simple staging, intermediate, and marts layout for my dbt project with naming examples.

prompt_templates.title: Tests and docs
prompt_templates.scenario: You need quality checks for key models
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft YAML tests and documentation for a customer dimension and orders fact model.

prompt_templates.title: Incremental setup
prompt_templates.scenario: A large table needs incremental loads
prompt_templates.prompt: Suggest an incremental model config for payments with a safe incremental filter.

prompt_templates.title: Macro refactor
prompt_templates.scenario: You want to reduce repeated SQL
prompt_templates.prompt: Show a macro pattern to standardize currency conversion and schema naming in dbt.

output_examples.input: Create a dbt structure for Stripe and Shopify data with staging and marts.
output: Set up staging models for Stripe customers and payments and Shopify orders
Add an intermediate model to aggregate payments by customer
Create marts for a customer dimension and orders fact with consistent naming

best_practices: Use a staging layer to clean sources once and reuse downstream
Add not null and unique tests for primary keys
Document models and columns as you build them
anti_patterns: Skip staging and join raw data directly into marts
Hardcode dates instead of using vars
Repeat logic instead of using macros

faq.question: Is this compatible with my dbt adapter?
faq.answer: Yes for general patterns, but SQL examples may need adapter specific changes.

faq.question: Are there limits on model size or count?
faq.answer: No limits are enforced; performance depends on your warehouse and project design.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with existing dbt projects?
faq.answer: Yes, apply the patterns to current models and update tests and docs incrementally.

faq.question: Does it access or store my data?
faq.answer: No, it provides guidance only and does not execute dbt or read your data.

faq.question: What if incremental models produce duplicates?
faq.answer: Review your unique_key and incremental filter and ensure updates are covered.

faq.question: How does this compare to dbt docs?
faq.answer: It is a concise pattern guide focused on practical structure and examples.
